dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 2872 IH: To amend the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 to allow States to issue electronic stamps under such Act, and for other purposes.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Graves of Louisiana (for himself and Mr. Thompson of California) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To amend the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 to allow States to issue electronic stamps under such Act, and for other purposes.

subsection.text: Section 5 of the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 (16 U.S.C. 718r) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the heading, by striking actual stamp and inserting electronic stamp;
by striking actual stamp and inserting electronic stamp; and
by amending paragraph (1) to read as follows:

paragraph.text: upon the date of purchase; and
in subsection (c), by inserting under subsection (e) before the period at the end; and
by redesignating subsection (e) as subsection (f) and inserting after subsection (d) the following new subsection:

subsection.text: A State shall issue an actual stamp after March 10 of each year to each individual that purchased an electronic stamp from such State during the 1-year period preceding such date.

subsection.header: Stamp valid through close of hunting season
subsection.text: Section 6 of the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 (16 U.S.C. 718s(c)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (b), by striking shall, during the effective period of the electronic stamp— and inserting shall—; and

in subsection (c), by striking for a period agreed to by the State and the Secretary, which shall not exceed 45 days and inserting until the first June 30 that occurs after the date of issuance of such stamp.

subsection.text: Section 1(a)(1) of the Migratory Bird Hunting and Conservation Stamp Act (16 U.S.C. 718a(a)(1)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by inserting as an electronic stamp or after Conservation Stamp,; and
by inserting actual after face of the.

subsection.text: Section 2(3) of the Permanent Electronic Duck Stamp Act of 2013 (16 U.S.C. 718o(3)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (E), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: may contain an image of the actual stamp.
